column4: highvoltage, i'm trying to follow the instructions from this page, http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=557274
download a macro and put it in a folder in usr/share,
but i can't, it tells me i don't have permission, even though i have gone to a shell as root
how do you change this so i can put files in /usr ?
unless that path is set as ro, you can write stuff as such
it is set up as read only for ;group', i.e. any one who is not owner, no?
if you can't do it even with root, then imo, there is something wrong

imo, root has control over any sort of restrictions imposed, by general means that is. If root cannot do it, then there is something not set up correctly.. maybe you have /usr as a different hdd/partition and that it is mounted as ro?
i do not have partitions or differeng hard drives
ok I presume / has mount settings as rw?
sorry for being to beginner here... you refer mount as the directory, mnt?
no mount as in the program 'mount'
if it is the mount executable file in bin, it is read and executable for group and others, but only write by owner
what I mean is type 'mount| grep /'
and tell me the output of that
i have put it in a private window
